content.description: Sit-start on the large horizontal jug just to the right of The Pearl.  Move out to the arete, work up the right side.  Move out left at the top and get a hand on the high lip of the boulder, then move over the top.
content.location: Right side of the Clamshell Boulder, next to The Pearl.

content.description: Sit-start using the two-hand cut on the left side of the boulder.  Move up the recessed area just to the left of the start.  Reach the top and begin moving out right to the highest point of the lip, then get a leg over the top.
content.location: Left side of the Clamshell Boulder, next to The Pearl.

content.description: Sit-start gripping one of the layers of the overlapping undercling, careful not to break loose pieces.  Move to crimps left, then reach up to holds generally above the start.  Get a decent foot, shoot straight up for the lip, and move over the top.
content.location: On the Clam Shell Boulder- just as you arrive at the Blue Ridge Summit overlook.  It's directly off the trail- can't miss it.

content.description: The Blue Ridge Summit Overlook is a point of interest on the hiking trails of Catoctin Mountain National Park.  The overlook features impressive views to the North and West, but also contains numerous boulders with varying styles of rock.
